description: From Middle English maladie, from Old French maladie (“sickness, illness, disease”), from malade (“ill, sick”), from Latin male habitus (“ill-kept, not in good condition”), 1st century AD. See also malice and habit.

entries.meaning: Any ailment or disease of the body; especially, a lingering or deep-seated disorder.
examples: The maladies of the body may prove medicines of the mind.

entries.meaning: A moral or mental defect or disorder.
